current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text: To codify an existing operations center for cybersecurity.

committee-name.#text: Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

action-instruction.#text: Insert the part printed in italic

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: National Cybersecurity and Communications Integration Center Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Cybersecurity and Communications Integration Center Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: National Cybersecurity and Communications Integration Center

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by
			 adding at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Subtitle A of title II of the Homeland Security Act of 2002

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: an operations center, which may carry out the responsibilities of the

with respect to security and
			 resilience,
			 including by—

text.#text: There is in the
serving as a Federal civilian information sharing interface for cybersecurity;

providing shared situational awareness to enable real-time, integrated, and operational actions
			 across the Federal Government;

sharing cybersecurity threat, vulnerability, impact, and incident information and analysis by and
			 among Federal,
			 State, and
			 local government entities and private sector entities;
coordinating cybersecurity information sharing throughout the Federal Government;
conducting analysis of cybersecurity risks and incidents;

upon request, providing timely technical assistance to Federal and non-Federal entities with
			 respect  to cybersecurity threats and attribution, vulnerability
			 mitigation, and incident response and remediation; and
providing recommendations on security and resilience measures to Federal and non-Federal entities.
The operations center shall be composed of—

personnel or other representatives of Federal agencies, including civilian and law enforcement
			 agencies and elements of the intelligence community, as such term is
			 defined under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 3(4) of the National Security Act of 1947

text.#text:
representatives from
			 State and local governments and other non-Federal entities, including—
representatives from information sharing and analysis organizations; and
private sector owners and operators of critical information systems.

short-title.#tail: , and every year thereafter for 3 years, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: National Cybersecurity and Communications Integration Center Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Cybersecurity and Communications Integration Center Act of 2014

Committee on Homeland

a report on the operations center, which shall

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Committee on Homeland Security of the House of

text.#text: Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of the
an analysis of the performance of the operations center in carrying out the functions under
information on the composition of the center, including—

the number of representatives from non-Federal entities that are participating in the operations
			 center, including the number of representatives from States, nonprofit
			 organizations, and private sector entities, respectively; and

the number of requests from non-Federal entities to participate in the operations center and the
			 response to such requests, including—

the average length of time to fulfill such identified requests by the Federal agency   responsible
			 for fulfilling such requests; and
a description of any obstacles or challenges to fulfilling such requests; and

the policies and procedures established by the operations center to safeguard privacy and civil
			 liberties.
